content: <1>Click here</1> to upgrade your tariff plan.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a call-to-action button that encourages users to upgrade their tariff plan. The text will appear as a clickable link within a UI component, likely part of an online quota management system. Translators should provide a clear and actionable message in the user's preferred language.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "لترقية خطة التعريف الخاصة بك" is not the most natural or accurate way to say 'to upgrade your tariff plan'. While technically correct, it can be improved for fluency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: انقر هنا لترقية باقتك.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tags <1> are inconsistent with standard practices. It's not clear what they are intended to signify.  They should be removed or replaced with a more standard format.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> tags.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags '<1>' and '</1>' are inconsistent with standard practice. They are likely intended to be a specific marker for the UI but should be reviewed and standardized.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review and standardize the HTML tag usage. Consider using a more conventional method for marking the clickable element, or ensure consistency with the rest of the application's markup.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tag `<1>` is present in both the source and translation. This tag may need to be removed or handled consistently depending on the application's requirements.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove or handle the `<1>` tag consistently with the application's implementation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'upgrade your tariff plan' is not ideally translated. 'Upgrade tarifního plánu' is a literal translation but sounds somewhat unnatural in Czech. A more natural phrasing would be 'zvýšení vašeho tarifu' or 'lepšího tarifu'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Klikněte zde pro zvýšení vašeho tarifu.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` tags are present in both the English and Czech text. These likely indicate placeholders and should be checked to ensure they are handled correctly in the implementation.  While not strictly incorrect, their presence warrants review.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify how the <1> tags are used and ensure they are handled correctly during integration.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "upgrade your tariff plan" has been translated as "päivittääksesi tilauksesi".  'Tilaus' translates to 'subscription' or 'order', not 'tariff plan'. A more accurate translation of 'tariff plan' would be 'liittymäpaketti' or 'datapaketti', depending on the context. While 'päivittääksesi' (to upgrade) is correct, the noun is incorrect.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'päivittääksesi liittymäpakettisi' or 'päivittääksesi datapakettisi' instead of 'päivittääksesi tilauksesi'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "upgrade your tariff plan" is better translated as "mettre à niveau votre abonnement" or "modifier votre offre". "Augmenter votre plan tarifaire" implies increasing the amount, not the tier or features.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Cliquez ici pour mettre à niveau votre abonnement.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> are inconsistent between the English and Armenian versions. The English uses <1>, while the Armenian uses <1>.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tagging. Either use <1> or </1> consistently across both versions.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'to upgrade your tariff plan' is not ideally translated. 'Fare l’upgrade' is a direct loan translation from English and sounds unnatural in Italian. A more natural phrasing would be 'aggiornare il tuo piano tariffario' or 'passare a un piano tariffario superiore'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Clicca qui per aggiornare il tuo piano tariffario.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "料金プランをアップグレードできます" (riyou puran o appugureedo dekiru) is a bit too formal and literal. A more natural phrasing would be something like "料金プランをアップグレードできます" or "プランをアップグレードできます"
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 料金プランをアップグレードできます

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The original English uses `<1>` tags for the clickable text. The Japanese translation maintains the same tags, but the use of `<1>` tags is uncommon in Japanese UI design. Consider using more standard UI element or span tags, or removing the tags altogether.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove or replace `<1>` tags with a standard HTML element or remove them entirely. The best approach would depend on the context of the UI.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags (<1>) are present in both the source and translation. While this may be intentional, it's worth noting and ensuring consistency with the overall system/platform where this text will be used.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify the purpose of the <1> tags and ensure consistency across all translations and the target platform. If they are purely for display, consider removing them if they are not needed.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "to upgrade your tariff plan" is not accurately translated. "ຍົກລະດັບແຜນການຄ່າບໍລິການຂອງທ່ານ" literally translates to 'upgrade your service plan', but 'tariff plan' has a specific meaning related to pricing tiers that might be lost in translation. A more precise translation might consider using a term more specific to 'tariff' if such a term exists in Lao.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider consulting with a subject matter expert to determine the most appropriate Lao term for 'tariff plan'. Possible alternatives might include researching how similar services are described in Lao and adapting the phrasing accordingly. If a direct equivalent doesn't exist, a more descriptive phrase might be necessary.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> are not standard and appear to be placeholders. They should be replaced with appropriate HTML tags if this is intended for display within an HTML environment.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace <1> with standard HTML tags like <span> or <a> if the text is intended for display in HTML.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: 'Click here' is translated as 'Apăsați aici'. While technically correct, 'Apăsați aici' is quite formal. A more natural and user-friendly translation might be 'Dați click aici' or 'Click aici'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Dați click aici

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovak translation includes 'a' which seems redundant. It's better to remove it for a more natural flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>Kliknite sem</1> aktualizujte svoj tarifný plán.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Click here' is translated as 'Кликните овде'. While understandable, a more natural and idiomatic translation would be 'Притисните овде'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Притисните овде

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` are inconsistent. The opening tag uses `<1>` while the closing tag uses `</1>`. This could cause rendering issues.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tag format. Use either `<1>` for both opening and closing tags, or use proper HTML elements.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` tags are inconsistent between the English and Serbian translations. The English version uses angled brackets, while the Serbian uses a combination of angled brackets and a non-standard tag.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent formatting of the tag. Either use `<1>` in both languages, or investigate the purpose of the non-standard tag and replicate it appropriately in the English version.  Ideally, remove the tags altogether and rely on standard HTML/CSS styling.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` tags are present in both the English and Ukrainian versions. While technically not incorrect, they are likely remnants from a UI/markup system and should be removed for a clean translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the `<1>` tags from the Ukrainian translation. The translation should be 'Натисніть тут, щоб підвищити тарифний план.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "费用版本" (feiyong banben) is not the most natural or accurate translation of "tariff plan." It literally means "fee version." A more appropriate translation would be something like "套餐" (taocan) or “资费计划” (zifei jihua).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider translating "tariff plan" as "套餐" (taocan) or “资费计划” (zifei jihua).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` tags are inconsistent with standard translation handling. They might be intended for highlighting, but should be removed or handled according to established practices. They can also create parsing issues.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the `<1>` tags and let the surrounding system handle any required highlighting or formatting.
